meanings.sent1: He made a doltish mistake by forgetting his keys again.
meanings.sent2: It was doltish of him to try and fix the computer without any knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The doltish cat tried to catch its own tail, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her doltish behavior in class was like a clown performing at a serious meeting.
meanings.sent5: The doltish decision to swim in a stormy sea almost cost him his life.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense
meanings.sent1: The doltish student kept asking the same question repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: It was doltish of him to believe everything he read on the internet.
meanings.sent3: The doltish squirrel tried to hide its acorns in the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her doltish actions at the party were like a comedy show for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The doltish driver ignored all the warning signs and got lost in the forest.
